title.rendered: She worked in a Chinese supermarket and was arrested for defrauding customers with Mercado Pago

content.rendered:
A 25-year-old woman who worked in a supermarket in La Plata was arrested on charges of defraud local customers who paid for purchases through Mercado Pago.

The procedure was carried out after Several people reported that their accounts showed purchases that they had not made.. The common denominator was the place where the operations were supposed to have taken place: the Chinese supermarket «King» located on 55th and 46th streets. As a result, an investigation was carried out that culminated in the arrest of the cashier.

The woman was identified as Rosa Ramona Arrua. According to the investigators, when she charged through the Mercado Pago platform. The detainee stole customers’ card details and then loaded the money into his own accounts..

The police also indicated that this person acted alone and the owners of the place were unaware of the situation. In a single day he made 16 trades between $1000 and $1500 each.

The woman was arrested Wednesday afternoon at a house on 157th and 42nd, where her cell phone was also seized. The cashier was charged with the crime of “repeated fraud.”
